intro: Benitoa occidentalis, commonly known as the western benitoa, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring or early summer. Benitoa occidentalis is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
